Trial_Design.evidence: This was a single-case study conducted at a tertiary care hospital.

Participants.evidence: An 80-year-old male patient with a ruptured IIAA and AVF was treated.

Intervention.evidence: The intervention involved temporary balloon occlusion of the AVF through the femoral vein, followed by EVAR with coil embolization.

Objective.evidence: This study aimed to evaluate the effectiveness of temporary balloon occlusion of an arteriovenous fistula (AVF) via the femoral vein in stabilizing hemodynamics before endovascular aneurysm repair (EVAR).

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was hemodynamic stability, assessed immediately post-intervention.

Result_Outcome.evidence: The patient achieved hemodynamic stability following the temporary balloon occlusion of the AVF.

Harms.evidence: Subsequent EVAR was performed successfully without complications.

Funding.evidence: The authors reported no funding sources for this study.
